name: Bondi Beach
summary: Sydney’s iconic surf beach, famous for its consistent waves and golden sands.

name: Mundaka
summary: Legendary Basque river mouth with world-class lefts.

name: Jeffreys Bay
summary: South Africa’s most famous right-hand point break, renowned for its long, fast walls.

name: Manu Bay
summary: New Zealand’s legendary left-hand point break, famous for its long rides.

name: Pipeline
summary: The Banzai Pipeline is Hawaii’s most famous and dangerous wave, known for its perfect barrels.

name: Teahupo o
summary: Tahiti’s Teahupo'o is world-renowned for its heavy, glassy barrels and thick reef break.

name: Snapper Rocks
summary: Australia’s Gold Coast gem, famous for its long, fast right-handers and the Superbank.

name: Hossegor
summary: France’s surfing capital, known for its powerful beach breaks and world-class competitions.

name: Trestles
summary: Southern California’s premier high-performance wave, popular with pros and locals alike.

name: Uluwatu
summary: Bali’s legendary left, set beneath dramatic cliffs, offering long rides and stunning sunsets.

name: Supertubos
summary: Portugal’s Supertubos is famed for its heavy, hollow beach break barrels.

name: Rincon
summary: California’s ‘Queen of the Coast’, offering long, peeling right-hand point break waves.

name: Waimea Bay
summary: Oahu’s historic big wave spot, home to legendary surf contests and massive winter swells.

name: Cloudbreak
summary: Fiji’s Cloudbreak is a powerful reef pass, delivering long, barreling lefts over shallow coral.

name: Praia da Joaquina
summary: Brazil’s Joaquina Beach is famous for its consistent waves and vibrant surf culture.
